simpledb

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpledb.Query
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Query is a wrapper class to manage the execution of queries. It takes a query plan in the form of a high level DbIterator (built by initiating the constructors of query plans) and runs it as a part of a specified transaction.
    Author:
    Sam Madden
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • next

        public Tuple next()
           throws DbException,
                  java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                  TransactionAbortedException
        Returns the next tuple, or throws NoSuchElementException if the iterator is closed.
        Returns:
        The next tuple in the iterator
        Throws:
        DbException - If there is an error in the database system
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the iterator has finished iterating
        TransactionAbortedException - If the transaction is aborted (e.g., due to a deadlock)
